---
title: "Dev resources"
description: A selection of Solidity/EVM dev resources
---

Arthera is an EVM-compatible network, which means that you can deploy your Solidity contracts without modifying them, and also use the EVM tooling available. Here's a selection of resources to learn Solidity and Web3 apps development.

### Boilerplates

Ideal for beginners, quick prototyping, and hackathons, you can use these app starter kits:

#### Arthera's

- [**Arthera Hardhat Template**](https://github.com/artheranet/arthera-hardhat-template)
- [**Arthera Next.js boilerplate**](https://github.com/artheranet/arthera-nextjs-boilerplate)

#### Others

- [**UseWeb3**](https://www.useweb3.xyz/)
- [**Developer DAO Academy**](https://academy.developerdao.com/)
- [**Bankless Academy**](https://app.banklessacademy.com/)

### Essentials

- [**Solidity docs**](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/)
- [**Hardhat**](https://hardhat.org/)
- [**Foundry**](https://book.getfoundry.sh/)
- [**Ethers.js**](https://docs.ethers.org/v6/)
- [**EVM Codes**](https://www.evm.codes)
- [**Open Zeppelin Wizard**](https://wizard.openzeppelin.com/)
- [**Ethereum.org dev resources**](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/)

### Security

- [**Ethernaut**](https://ethernaut.openzeppelin.com/)

### Indexing

- [**SQD**](https://docs.sqd.dev/subsquid-network/reference/evm-networks/)

### Devs to follow

- [**Nader Dabit**](https://twitter.com/dabit3)
- [**Patrick Collins**](https://twitter.com/PatrickAlphaC)
- [**Austin Griffith**](https://twitter.com/austingriffith)
- [**Paul Razvan Berg**](https://twitter.com/PaulRBerg)
